There are several Greek words for "love" that are regularly referred to in Christian circles.
 
* ''[[Agape]]'': In the [[New Testament]], ''[[Agape|agapē]]'' is charitable, selfless, altruistic, and unconditional. [[Benedict XVI]] wrote his first encyclical on [[Deus caritas est|God is love]]. He said that a human being, created in the image of God, who is love, is able to practice love: to give himself to God and others ([[agape]]) and by receiving and experiencing God's love in contemplation (eros). This life of love, according to him, is the life of the saints such as [[Teresa of Calcutta]] and the [[Blessed Virgin Mary]] and is the direction Christians take when they believe that God loves them.<ref name="vatican1"/>
